verses.roman:
ṛṣir uvāca
evaṁ sañcoditau mātrā
rāmaḥ kṛṣṇaś ca bhārata
sutalaṁ saṁviviśatur
yoga-māyām upāśritau

synonyms: ṛṣiḥ uvāca—the sage (Śrī Śukadeva) said; evam—thus; sañcoditau—urged; mātrā—by Their mother; rāmaḥ—Balarāma; kṛṣṇaḥ—Kṛṣṇa; ca—and; bhārata—O descendant of Bhārata (Parīkṣit); sutalam—the subterranean planet of Sutala, ruled by Bali Mahārāja; saṁviviśatuḥ—They entered; yoga-māyāyam—Their mystic pastime potency; upāśritau—utilizing.
translation: The sage Śukadeva said: Thus entreated by Their mother, O Bhārata, Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa employed Their mystic Yogamāyā potency and entered the region of Sutala.
